TypeSignature.Value: public class EditorInfo : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, Android.Text.IInputType, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EditorInfo extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Text.IInputType, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type EditorInfo = class inherit Object interface IParcelable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IInputType

Docs.summary: An EditorInfo describes several attributes of a text editing object that an input method is communicating with (typically an EditText), most importantly the type of text content it contains and the current cursor position.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ActionId : int with get, set

Docs.summary: If #actionLabel has been given, this is the id for that command when the user presses its button that is delivered back with InputConnection#performEditorAction(int) InputConnection.performEditorAction().

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ActionLabel : Java.Lang.ICharSequence with get, set

Docs.summary: In some cases an IME may be able to display an arbitrary label for a command the user can perform, which you can specify here.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetInitialSelectedText(int32 flags) cil managed

Docs.param: Supplies additional options controlling how the text is returned. May be either 0 or InputConnection#GET_TEXT_WITH_STYLES.
Docs.summary: Gets the selected text, if any.
Docs.returns: the text that is currently selected, if any. It could be an empty string when there is no text selected. When null is returned, the selected text might be too long or this protocol is not supported.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.ICharSequence GetInitialSelectedTextFormatted(int32 flags) cil managed

Docs.param: Supplies additional options controlling how the text is returned. May be either 0 or InputConnection#GET_TEXT_WITH_STYLES.
Docs.summary: Gets the selected text, if any.
Docs.returns: the text that is currently selected, if any. It could be an empty string when there is no text selected. When null is returned, the selected text might be too long or this protocol is not supported.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Views.InputMethods.SurroundingText GetInitialSurroundingText (int beforeLength, int afterLength, int flags);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.InputMethods.SurroundingText GetInitialSurroundingText(int32 beforeLength, int32 afterLength, int32 flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The expected length of the text before the cursor.
The expected length of the text after the cursor.
Supplies additional options controlling how the text is returned. May be either 0 or InputConnection#GET_TEXT_WITH_STYLES.
Docs.summary: Gets the surrounding text around the current cursor, with <var>beforeLength</var> characters of text before the cursor (start of the selection), <var>afterLength</var> characters of text after the cursor (end of the selection), and all of the selected text.
Docs.returns: an android.view.inputmethod.SurroundingText object describing the surrounding text and state of selection, or null if the editor or system could not support this protocol.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetInitialTextAfterCursor (int length, int flags);
.method public hidebysig instance string GetInitialTextAfterCursor(int32 length, int32 flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The expected length of the text.
Supplies additional options controlling how the text is returned. May be either 0 or InputConnection#GET_TEXT_WITH_STYLES.
Docs.summary: Get <var>length</var> characters of text after the current cursor position.
Docs.returns: the text after the cursor position; the length of the returned text might be less than <var>length</var>. When there is no text after the cursor, an empty string will be returned. It could also be null when the editor or system could not support this protocol.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.HintText : Java.Lang.ICharSequence with get, set

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetInitialSurroundingSubText (Java.Lang.ICharSequence subText, int subTextStart);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetInitialSurroundingSubText(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence subText, int32 subTextStart) cil managed

Docs.param: The input text. When it was trimmed, subTextStart must be provided correctly.
The position that the input text got trimmed. For example, when the editor wants to trim out the first 10 chars, subTextStart should be 10.
Docs.summary: Editors may use this method to provide initial input text to IMEs.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
